Only in between trips, so this will be brief:
1) Mitchell of EBF is protesting the Morris letter as "Character-
Assassinationn and asking retraction. Did not address us, but
Steetle (and Morris). Did talk to me in Chicago yesterday. I
chatted with Morris first. Suggested to Mitchell that we»d be

officers, bu^suggested, since quotes seemed authenticated that
we not get jSfto t^o wide distribution or it would become worse
rather than better. Keeping in touch with Cohn and Morris. Will
keep you inforaed.
2) If NAEB is to be active before the FCC on multiplex and other
issues, I need guidance. Dp to the present, KAEB reactions
seem conflicting, so I’ve done nothing but request that Cohn
and Marks watch and report to us. I believe our AM-TV-FM
members-status makes a unified "NAEB Stand" on this very difficult.
Do you favor the proposed multiplexing proposal?
3) Next couple of weeks I’ll be out of town most of time. Office can
always reach me (Chicago March 5 (Hewburn) and 9 ( Griffiths).)
East Lansing March 14-17; Battle Creek March 18 at Van Duyn
invitation.
V
4) DAVI Audio-Visual Members very interested in our albums. Also
continuing discussion, with them, of duplication possibilities,
if and when we have facilities, and if and when their project is
further clarified. Rather nebulous yet.
5) Re: New York Monitoring Study. Mr. Remmers says that the results are
coming out of the Statistical Bureau at Purdue in "great gobs"
He hopes to have a preliminary report by next month.
